user_query: even if they don't communicate verbally, rather than on the family that shares his blood with him Then one day, he gets shot by his father and loses his little finger, and the bullet gets lodged in his spinal cord, leaving him paralyzed from the waist down His father committed suicide after being sentenced to 20 years in prison, and his older brother was mauled to death by dogs on the day he was released after serving a 12-year sentence It's interesting how Caleb tells Jojo what virtues only dogs have that humans don't Beauty without vanity, strength without arrogance, courage without cruelty, Yet the dog has one flaw, and that is... 'he trusts humans' He dresses up as a woman and sings on stage, he beats up gangs that harass good people, and he shares the wealth of rich people who don't even know how much money they have with the help of dogs... among the dogs Then, he is eventually attacked by a gang, and Caleb, who kills the gang with his dogs, is finally saved with his dogs under the shadow of the cross The heart of this film is a truly outstanding performance by Caleb Landry Jones He has already worked with world-class directors such as the Coen brothers, David Fincher, Brandon Cronenberg, Neil Jordan, John Boorman, Roland Emmerich, Jordan Peele, and Sean Baker, but I don't think I've ever seen him take on a solo lead role in an entire film, except for 'Antiviral (2012)' The fact that this film was directed and written by Luc Besson was a factor in its success in the
